content.description:
Lead Boogaloo 5.8 or The Roof 5.9 to get up to the anchors, or another route like The Trough 5.5 to the top and then rap down and left to the anchors.

From the anchors traverse left past Left Flake and then up the short crack. The crack dies out after about 20 feet and is filled with grass, from here you can follow the grassy crack up and run it out or traverse left 5 feet and take another flake up for 10 feet (protectable). From there head up and right to the anchors above Left Flake/Right Flake/Let it Bleed.

To me the crux was traversing left once you past Left Flake, you can put a cam in to protect a swing here. It's a real easy fun move because you get some instant exposure. Then there is another crux maybe 5 feet up the crack and then it's easy to the top.
content.protection:
Light rack, bolted anchors at the top.

Slings are useful to cut down on rope drag.
content.location: This is the small short crack to the left of the 2 other cracks/flakes on the top half of the Main Slab.

content.description: This fun crack climb is one of the few trad routes at Big Rock and a great climb for a beginner trad leader.  Easy to protect with fun moves.
content.protection: Standard rack Bolted anchor with Fixe rings.
content.location: Starts on a ledge above Boogaloo.  On the right side of the ledge, follow the obvious right-facing crack/corner system.

content.description: This is the face climb that is just to right of Right Flake (5.7) climbing past a 2 bolts and a small cam in the Right Flake on thin smearing.
content.location: Can serve as a second pitch to Wedunett (5.6) or Boogaloo Direct (5.9)

content.description:
Far from featureless, Let It Bleed climbs the polished slab between the climbs Left Flake and Right Flake.

From a bolted belay on the sloping ledge atop The Shroud and Bugaloo, move up and right on small crystals and friction past three bolts. Between the 3rd and 4th bolts, continuing straight up yields to 5.10b/c fiction while moving right toward the edge of Right Flake goes at 5.10a. Continue on friction and small crimps past two more bolts to a shared anchor with the Flakes, the Trough, Cheap Thrills, The Trough, and African Flake

to the right.

If you listen carefully, the sound of bats squeaking and rustling can be heard emanating from deep within the flake next to the belay. Try not to consider the implications of Histoplasmosis from exposure to bat droppings, as you belay your partner up the polished slab.
content.location: The route starts on a large ledge above Boogaloo direct.  Follow the obvious line of bolts between the two right-facing dihedrals.

content.description: A fun route up a right-facing dihedral with a small finger crack.  Fun moves up the crack, with the crux about 1/3 of the way up the crack.
content.protection: Standard rack (a few small-med cams), bolted anchor
content.location:
Route starts on a large ledge directly above

Boogaloo

. Rap anchors on top, and at the base. Climb starts at the left-most end of the ledge.

content.description: The route climbs good rock and serves as a second pitch to such routes as Wedunett or Crater Maker.  It is the rightmost of the two bolted lines starting from the belay ledge.  Nice smearing footwork is what it's all about.
